derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Latin devotio(n-), from devovere 'consecrate' (see devote)

entry.def: Devotion is great love, affection, or admiration for someone.

example.ex: At first she was flattered by his devotion.
example.tran: 刚开始他的爱慕让她感到荣幸。

entry.def: Devotion is commitment to a particular activity.

example.ex: ...devotion to the cause of the people and to socialism...
example.tran: 献身于人民的事业，献身于社会主义

example.ex: I don't mean to keep criticising his devotion to his job.
example.tran: 我并不是要一再批评他对工作的专注。

entry.def: Devotion is religious worship or strong religious feeling.

example.ex: He was kneeling by his bed in an attitude of devotion.

sentences.sentence: "their devotion to each other was beautiful"
"the devotion of his time and wealth to science"

means.word_mean: 3. religious zeal; willingness to serve God
4. (usually plural) religious observance or prayers (usually spoken silently);

stems_affixes.value_cn: 专心的, 献身的, 信仰的, 虔诚的, 祷告的
stems_affixes.word_buile: devotion[n.献身,热诚,专心]+al……的→献身的,虔诚的
devote[v.[to]奉献,致力]+ion表名词→n.献身,热诚,专心
vot忠于,发誓+e→n.投票,表决;选票,选票数 v.投票,表决
vote[n.投票,表决;选票,选票数 v.投票,表决]+er人→voter投票者
de加强+vot忠于,发誓+e→拼命发誓→献身
vot忠于,发誓+e→n.投票,表决;选票,选票数 v.投票,表决

sentences.en: His devotion to the cause of education is well-known.
sentences.cn: 他对教育事业的献身精神是众所周知的。

jushi.english: She nursed her sick child with devotion.
jushi.chinese: 她悉心看护她那生病的孩子。

jushi.english: He is an example of devotion to duty.
Their mutual devotion gave them great strength.
jushi.chinese: 他们互相疼爱给了他们巨大的力量。
